metadata.title: CVE-2022-48672 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: of:fdt: fix off-by-one error in unflatten_dt_nodes() Commit 78c44d910d3e("drivers/of: Fix depth when unflattening devicetree") forgot to fix up thedepth check in the loop body in unflatten_dt_nodes() which makes itpossible to overflow the nps[] buffer... Found by Linux Verification Center(linuxtesting.org) with the SVACE static analysis tool.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
